question:
Which among the following about the Royal Commission on Decentralization are correct?
1. It was set up in 1907 by the British Government
2. Its main objective was to investigate the financial and administrative relations of Central and provincial government
3. The only Indian member of this commission was R.C. Dutt
4. The report of this commission was published in 1909
Choose the correct option from the codes given below :
explanation: In the year 1907, the Royal Commission on Decentralization was constituted by the British Government. Its main objective was to investigate the financial and administrative relations of the Central and provincial governments. The only Indian member of this commission was R.C. Dutt. The report of this commission was published in 1909.
